Module com.example.sudokuminiproject2
Package com.example.sudokuminiproject2.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudokuminiproject2.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController class handles user interactions in the game stage of the game. It manages the input for the game, validates guesses, updates the UI, and controls game logic such as winning and losing conditions.

The game board is represented by a 6x6 grid of TextField elements, which are organized into a 2D list. This controller also handles hints, mistakes, and other game mechanics.

See Also:
  • GameBoard
  • Board

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the game controller by setting up the game board, text fields, and the timer. This method is called automatically after the FXML file has been loaded.

    • validCorrectNumber

      public void validCorrectNumber(int number, int row, int col)
      Validates whether the number entered in the specified position is correct based on the game rules. If the number is correct, it updates the style to "correct"; otherwise, it sets the style to "incorrect".
      Parameters:
      number - the number entered by the user
      row - the row index of the number
      col - the column index of the number
      See Also:
      • GameBoard.isNumberByColumnAllowed(int, int, int)
      • GameBoard.isNumberByRowAllowed(int, int, int)
      • GameBoard.isNumberByBoxAllowed(int, int, int)

    • fixIncorrects

      public void fixIncorrects()
      Fixes the incorrect numbers on the game board by re-validating them. Iterates through the board, and for each cell marked as incorrect in the mistakesBoard, re-validates the number and updates the display accordingly.
      See Also:
      • validCorrectNumber(int, int, int)

    • highlightIncorrectNumbers

      public void highlightIncorrectNumbers(int number, int row, int col)
      Highlights incorrect numbers in the specified row and column, marking them with a red background.
      Parameters:
      number - the incorrect number to highlight
      row - the row index of the cell being validated
      col - the column index of the cell being validated

    • clearIncorrectNumbersHighlight

      public void clearIncorrectNumbersHighlight(int row, int col)
      Clears the red background highlight from incorrect cells in the box, row, and column.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the cell
      col - the column index of the cell

    • showGameBoard

      public void showGameBoard()
      Displays the game board with initial hints. This method sets the initial hints on the board, updates the text fields with the corresponding numbers, and makes the fields uneditable if they contain a valid number between 1 and 6.
      See Also:
      • GameBoard.setInitialHints()

    • win

      public void win()
      Handles the win condition of the game. If the player has won, the board becomes uneditable, the pause button is disabled, and a congratulatory alert is shown. The alert also displays the time taken to solve the puzzle, and flower petals are animated to fall on the dialog pane.
      See Also:
      • GameBoard.isWinner()
      • handlePauseButton()

    • restartTextFieldBoard

      public void restartTextFieldBoard()
      Resets the text fields on the game board. This method clears all text fields, makes them editable, and resets their style to the default.
      See Also:
      • handleNewGame(ActionEvent)
